Extending for about 500 km along the

) is a region of remote and rugged shores backed by lush and hazy mountains. The main drawcards, though, are the old towns dotting the region from one end to the other, both on the coast and inland, and ranging from run-down and modest to the perfectly renovated and up and ready for tourism, and the pristine, scenic mountain lakes.

, Western Karadeniz often goes unexplored by the travellers, and for most, it is simply a line of blurry mountain and forest images on the other side of the window when transiting through the motorway between
